page.title: 11FARMHOUSE NEAR DUFTON
page.content: Along the Keisley road,the houses are mainly small,low ones with a long sweep of roof facing the fell wind as protection.Inside,the rooms are low, but seated by the windows, you see the whole valley and the Lake District Fells beyond.A kitchen I know belongs to an elderly couple,farmers,with 2 bachelor sons,who live at home.2 of the married daughters live on farms either side & they come home regularly to help with washing & baking.As a visitor,you sit in front of a glowing fire & look at the view past the clutter of baking ingredients & busy hands shaping the pasties.You chat to the old folk in their chairs & to the others passing through the room & talk about market prices,old days, young children,the state of the weather,until you have forgotten about time....
